edu.umass.cs.benchlab.har

Class HarDatabaseConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.benchlab.har.HarDatabaseConfig

  • public class HarDatabaseConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a HarDatabaseConfig
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Emmanuel Cecchet

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates a new HarDatabaseConfig object to store/retrieve HAR representations in/from a database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HarDatabaseConfig

        public HarDatabaseConfig(java.lang.String driverClassName,
                 java.lang.String jdbcUrl,
                 java.lang.String login,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 java.lang.String tablePrefix,
                 java.lang.String dbAutoGeneratedId,
                 java.lang.String stringDbType,
                 java.lang.String longDbType,
                 java.lang.String timestampDbType,
                 java.lang.String smallIntDbType)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a new HarDatabaseConfig object to store/retrieve HAR representations in/from a database.
        Parameters:
        driverClassName - Class name of the database driver
        jdbcUrl - the JDBC URL to access the databsae
        login - database user login
        password - database user password
        tablePrefix - prefix to use in front of table names
        dbAutoGeneratedId - database type to define an auto-generated key (if null, "BIGINT PRIMARY KEY GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY" is used)
        stringDbType - database type to define a string type (if null, "LONG VARCHAR" is used)
        longDbType - database type to define a long type (if null, "BIGINT" is used)
        timestampDbType - type to define a timestamp type (if null, "TIMESTAMP" is used)
        smallIntDbType - type to defined a small int type (if null, "SMALLINT" is used)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database driver cannot be loaded

    • Method Detail

      • getHarLogIds

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getHarLogIds()
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return the list of HarLog ids stored in the database. Use new HarLog.HarLog(HarDatabaseConfig, long) to fetch HarLog entries.
        Returns:
        list of HarLog ids
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a db error occurs

      • getNbOfEntries

        public long getNbOfEntries(java.lang.String tableName)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Return the number of entries stored in the database table
        Parameters:
        tableName - name of the table to COUNT(*)
        Returns:
        number of entries in the given table
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a db error occurs

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieve a database connection using the current configuration. Note: this returned Collection object is always the same since we want to disable autocommit.
        Returns:
        a connection to the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occured creating the database

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection(java.sql.Connection c)
        Close the given connection (actually put it back as is in the connection pool)
        Parameters:
        c - connection to close

      • writeNameValueCommentJDBC

        public long writeNameValueCommentJDBC(long logId,
                             HarDatabaseConfig config,
                             java.lang.String tableName,
                             java.lang.String nameColumn,
                             java.lang.String nameValue,
                             java.lang.String valueColumn,
                             java.lang.String valueValue,
                             java.lang.String commentColumn,
                             java.lang.String commentValue)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Write this object in the given database referencing the specified logId.
        Parameters:
        logId - the logId this object refers to
        config - the database configuration
        tableName - name of the table to insert data into (without the table prefix)
        nameColumn - name of the name column
        nameValue - value of the name field
        valueColumn - name of the value column
        valueValue - value of the value field
        commentColumn - name of the comment column
        commentValue - value of the comment field
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs *

      • dropTableIfEmpty

        public void dropTableIfEmpty(java.sql.Connection c,
                    java.lang.String tableName,
                    HarDatabaseConfig config)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Check if a table is empty with a COUNT(*) and drop it if it is.
        Parameters:
        c - an open connection to the database
        tableName - the name of the table to check
        config - database config to be updated if the table is dropped (cache update)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs

      • deleteFromTable

        public void deleteFromTable(long logId,
                   HarDatabaseConfig config,
                   java.lang.String tableName)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete objects in the given database table referencing the specified logId. Drop the table if empty after deleting elements.
        Parameters:
        logId - the logId this object refers to
        config - the database configuration
        tableName - name of the table to insert data into (without the table prefix)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs *

      • addCreatedTable

        public void addCreatedTable(java.lang.String tableName)
        Add a table to the list of tables that have been created
        Parameters:
        tableName - the table that has been created (or already exists)

      • isCreatedTable

        public boolean isCreatedTable(java.lang.String tableName)
        Returns true if the given table name is in the list of created tables
        Parameters:
        tableName - the table to look for
        Returns:
        true if the table has been set as created

        Parameters:
        tableName - the table that has been removed
